item.title: 汉堡王母公司 Restaurant Brands 因需求强劲，收入超出预期
item.description: 周二，Restaurant Brands International 第一季度营收超出华尔街预期，原因是汉堡王连锁店的需求复苏支持了 Tim Horton 分店的强劲表现。【原文：Restaurant Brands International beat Wall Street expectations for first-quarter revenue on Tuesday, as a revival in demand at its Burger King chain supported strength at its Tim Horton outlets.】

item.title: 因提价和削减成本，3M 季度利润大幅增长
item.description: 由于提价和成本削减抵消了销售放缓的影响，美国工业集团 3M 公司周二公布的季度利润增长了 21%。【原文：U.S. industrial conglomerate 3M Co posted a 21% rise in quarterly profit on Tuesday as price hikes and cost cuts offset the impact from slow sales.】

item.title: 莱多斯公司上调 2024 年国防需求预测
item.description: 美国防务公司莱多斯控股公司（Leidos Holdings）周二上调了年度利润和收入预期，认为在地缘政治紧张局势日益加剧的情况下，武器需求强劲，国防开支增加。【原文：U.S. defense company Leidos Holdings lifted its annual profit and revenue forecasts on Tuesday, banking on strong weapons demand and increased defense spending amid growing geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: Meta 在欧盟调查中为其风险缓解程序辩护
item.description: 欧盟委员会对 Meta 旗下的 Facebook 和 Instagram 发起调查，称其未能在欧洲议会选举前处理欺骗性广告和虚假信息，Meta 周二为自己的风险缓解程序进行了辩护。【原文：Meta on Tuesday defended its risk mitigating process after the European Commission launched an investigation into its Facebook and Instagram for failing to tackle deceptive advertising and disinformation ahead of European Parliament elections.】

item.title: 瓶装可口可乐 HBC 因需求强劲而收入超出预期
item.description: 装瓶商可口可乐公司（Coca-Cola HBC）周二公布的第一季度收入超出市场预期，并重申在咖啡、能量饮料和气泡饮料强劲需求的支撑下，今年的营业利润将进一步增长。【原文：Bottler Coca-Cola HBC beat market forecast for first-quarter revenue on Tuesday, and reiterated that its operating profit will expand further this year, supported by strong demand for its coffee, energy and sparkling drinks.】

item.title: 有人陷入泥潭吗？美联储观察家试图预测扑朔迷离的现状
item.description: 去年年底，美国央行官员开始掀起降息热潮，当时经济似乎已走上回归低通胀的明确道路，官员们预计今年借贷成本将稳步下降，但从那时起，政策制定过程基本上停滞不前。【原文：U.S. central bankers began spreading rate-cut fever late last year, with the economy seemingly on a clear path back to low inflation and officials projecting a steady drop in borrowing costs this year, but since then the policymaking process has essentially ground to a halt.】

item.title: 时尚集团爱马仕誓言在 Birkin 诉讼案中 "积极辩护
item.description: 爱马仕时装公司在加利福尼亚州被起诉，称其非法允许只有在该公司有 "足够购买记录 "的客户才能购买其著名的 Birkin 手袋，该公司誓言将 "积极为自己辩护"。【原文：Fashion company Hermes vowed to 'vigorously defend itself' in a lawsuit filed against it in California claiming it unlawfully allows only customers with "sufficient purchase history" with the company to buy its famed Birkin handbags.】

item.title: 聚焦：下岗：前泰森食品公司养鸡户转产鸡蛋面临高昂成本
item.description: 泰森食品公司关闭了六家工厂后，一些曾经为该公司饲养屠宰鸡的美国农民转而出售鸡蛋，此举使当地供应商的工作选择受到限制。【原文：Some U.S. farmers who once raised chickens for Tyson Foods to slaughter are shifting to sell eggs instead after the meatpacker closed six plants, a move that left local suppliers with limited options for work.】

item.title: 馏分油需求令人失望，交易商争相在美国储存馏分油
item.description: 仓储经纪商 The Tank Tiger 周一提供的数据显示，交易商正急于将柴油和取暖油等馏分燃料装满美国东海岸的储油罐，这是供应过剩加剧的一个迹象，正在拖累炼油商的利润。【原文：Traders are rushing to fill up storage tanks along the U.S. East Coast with distillate fuels, like diesel and heating oil, data from storage broker The Tank Tiger showed on Monday, a sign of deepening oversupply that is weighing on refiners' profits.】

item.title: 亚马逊公司可能感受到了加入分红俱乐部的压力
item.description: 电子商务巨头亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）可能会面临越来越大的向投资者分红的压力，因为它现在发现自己是美国少数几家没有定期向股东分红的大型科技和成长型公司之一。【原文：E-commerce titan Amazon.com may be under increasing pressure to offer investors a dividend, as it now finds itself one of the few massive U.S. technology and growth companies not making regular payouts to shareholders.】

item.title: 沃尔玛推出全新自有品牌食品，竞争日趋白热化
item.description: 本周二，沃尔玛首次推出了一个新的自有品牌食品，其中大部分产品的价格都在 5 美元以下，目的是在竞争对手零售商纷纷扩大自己的产品线之际，改进和增加自己的产品。【原文：Walmart debuted a new private-label food brand on Tuesday, with most of the products priced under $5, as it aims to improve and grow its offerings at a time when rival retailers are expanding their own lines.】

item.title: Facebook 和 Instagram 因涉嫌违反技术规则而受到欧盟关注
item.description: 欧盟委员会周二表示，Meta Platforms 旗下的 Facebook 和 Instagram 未能在欧洲议会重要选举之前解决欺骗性广告和虚假信息问题，欧盟委员会同时对涉嫌违反欧盟网络内容规则的行为展开调查。【原文：Meta Platforms' Facebook and Instagram have failed to tackle deceptive advertising and disinformation ahead of key European Parliament elections, the European Commission said on Tuesday as it opened an investigation into suspected breaches of EU online content rules.】

item.title: 美联储的资产负债表计划可能成为本周的中心议题
item.description: 一些经济学家表示，美联储最早可能在本周的政策会议上宣布启动资产负债表缩减的终局，尽管在通胀胶着的情况下，利率前景的不确定性可能会将 "缩表 "声明推迟到6月份。【原文：An announcement from the Federal Reserve to kick off the end game for its balance sheet runoff could come as early as this week's policy meeting, a number of economists say, though an uncertain outlook for interest rates amid sticky inflation could push a "tapering" declaration back to June.】

item.title: Binance 首席执行官赵某因违反洗钱规定面临判刑
item.description: 全球最大加密货币交易所 Binance 的前首席执行官在承认违反美国洗钱法后，可能在周二被判刑。【原文：The former chief executive of Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, could face years in prison when he is sentenced on Tuesday after his guilty plea to violating U.S. money-laundering laws.】

item.title: 早间竞价：亚马逊到期、财政部计划惹恼，日元再度下滑
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 焦点转向利率决议，期货走低
item.description: 追踪华尔街主要股指的期货周二表现低迷，因为在美联储为期两天的会议结束做出利率决定之前，投资者没有下大赌注，而且还有更多最新财报公布。【原文：Futures tracking Wall Street's main indexes were subdued on Tuesday as investors refrained from placing big bets ahead of the interest rate decision at the end of the Federal Reserve's two-day meeting, with more earnings updates on tap.】

item.title: 全球银行监管机构针对客户风险处置中的管理不善问题
item.description: 全球银行业监管机构周二建议，银行在评估客户风险时应采用更严格的标准，以避免出现因 Archegos 倒闭而凸显的管理不善问题，以及大宗商品和英国政府债券市场的剧烈波动。【原文：Global banking regulators on Tuesday proposed stricter standards for banks when assessing risks from customers to avoid the mismanagement highlighted by the collapse of Archegos, and episodes of volatility in commodities and Britain's government bond market.】

item.title: 监管机构称比亚迪将在中国产品召回中修复 16,666 辆海鸥电动车的软件问题
item.description: 中国市场监管部门周二表示，比亚迪将从5月20日起修复16,666辆海鸥牌电动车的软件，以降低事故发生几率。【原文：BYD will fix software in 16,666 Seagull electric vehicles from May 20 to reduce the chance of accidents, China's market regulator said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧元区经济衰退后第一季度增长超预期
item.description: 欧洲统计局（Eurostat）周二公布的初步数据显示，受德国经济恢复增长和西班牙经济强劲扩张的提振，欧元区2024年第一季度的经济增长超过预期。【原文：The euro zone economy grew by more than expected in the first quarter of 2024, buoyed by a return to growth for Germany and strong expansion in Spain, preliminary data from the European statistics agency Eurostat showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 疫情过后，香港企业纷纷停业，努力恢复生机
item.description: 十多年前，当 48 岁的 Jacky Yu 在香港开设他的日本礼品店时，旺角的旅游和购物区还是一个熙熙攘攘的中心，到处都是摊位、街头小吃和游客。【原文：When Jacky Yu, 48, opened his Japanese gift shop in Hong Kong more than a decade ago, the tourist and shopping district of Mong Kok was a bustling hub packed with stalls, street food and tourists.】

item.title: 转向新车型、需求疲软打击欧洲汽车制造商
item.description: 本周二，大众汽车、梅赛德斯-奔驰和斯泰伦特公司都公布了销量和第一季度收入下降，原因是它们都在为推出新车型做准备，而且由于利率居高不下，消费者对新车的需求减弱。【原文：Volkswagen , Mercedes-Benz and Stellantis all posted lower sales and first-quarter revenue on Tuesday as they geared up to launch new models and faced weaker consumer demand for new cars as interest rates remain high.】

item.title: 德国经济避开衰退
item.description: 今年年初，由于建筑业投资和出口的拉动，德国经济略有增长，但增长幅度超过预期，避免了经济衰退。【原文：The German economy skirted a recession at the start of the year, growing modestly but more than expected thanks to investment in construction and exports.】

item.title: 在必和必拓权衡对盎格鲁集团的坚定收购之际，投资者担心会出现 "偷梁换柱 "的情况
item.description: 英美资源集团的投资者告诉路透社，必和必拓集团不能在不支付高额溢价的情况下挑选英美资源集团的资产，他们担心持有南非子公司的股份会让他们损失惨重。【原文：BHP Group can't cherry pick Anglo American assets without paying a hefty premium, Anglo investors told Reuters, concerned that they stand to lose heavily by holding shares in South African subsidiaries.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金支持百事公司生物多样性风险评估竞标
item.description: 挪威主权财富基金计划支持一项股东提案，要求百事公司进行生物多样性风险评估，以衡量这家软饮料和零食巨头的业务对生物多样性丧失的脆弱性。【原文：Norway's sovereign wealth fund plans to back a shareholder proposal demanding PepsiCo conduct a biodiversity risk assessment to gauge how vulnerable the soft drink and snacks giant's operations are to biodiversity loss.】

item.title: 欧洲股市在通胀数据公布前的盈利潮中表现低迷
item.description: 周二，欧洲股市开盘后表现低迷，投资者在关注欧元区4月份通胀等经济数据的同时，也在分析各行业重量级企业的大量财报。【原文：European shares opened trade on a subdued note on Tuesday, as investors parsed a deluge of corporate earnings reports from industry heavyweights while keeping an eye out for economic data including the euro zone's inflation for April.】

item.title: 尽管涡扇发动机面临困境，但欧洲战斗机订单使 MTU 航空发动机公司第一季度利润上升
item.description: 德国发动机制造商MTU航空发动机公司周二公布的第一季度财报显示，受欧洲联合欧洲战斗机项目订单的推动，该公司第一季度盈利增加，同时其涡扇发动机召回活动仍在按计划进行。【原文：German engine manufacturer MTU Aero Engines reported higher first-quarter earnings on Tuesday, boosted by orders from the joint European Eurofighter jet project while its turbofan engines recall campaign remained on track.】

item.title: 阿尔诺-拉加代尔因法院起诉辞去行政职务
item.description: 法国拉加代尔公司（Lagardere SA）董事长兼首席执行官阿尔诺-拉加代尔（Arnaud Lagardere）周二表示，由于早前被法院起诉，他将不得不辞去高管职务，并将就此提出上诉。【原文：Arnaud Lagardere, the chairman and CEO of French company Lagardere SA , will have to resign from his executive roles as a result of an earlier court indictment against which he will appeal, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 卫星公司 SES 将以 31 亿美元收购 Intelsat
item.description: 卫星公司 SES 周二表示，已同意以约 31 亿美元的价格收购 Intelsat Holdings 的全部股份，这笔交易将打造一个欧洲行业巨头。【原文：Satellite company SES has agreed to buy all the shares of Intelsat Holdings for about $3.1 billion in a deal that would create a European giant in the industry, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 受罢工影响的三家 Stellantis 工厂将于五月初重启生产
item.description: Stellantis发言人周二表示，在找到替代零部件采购方案后，Stellantis在欧洲的三家装配厂将于5月初重新开始生产。【原文：Production at three Stellantis assembly plants in Europe will restart in the first days of May, a spokesman said on Tuesday, after the automaker found alternative solutions for the sourcing of parts.】

item.title: 法航荷航第一季度业绩逊于预期，成本飙升
item.description: 法航荷航集团周二报告称，由于面临荷兰航空公司荷航高额的客户赔偿和一次性支付给员工的费用，第一季度运营亏损达 4.89 亿欧元（5.2431 亿美元），高于预期。【原文：Airline group Air France-KLM on Tuesday reported a higher than expected first quarter operating loss of 489 million euros ($524.31 million) as it faced high customer compensation at Dutch carrier KLM and one-off payments to staff.】
